availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Born on September 15, 1797. attorney. Native of Bath County. Employed in the county clerkâ€™s office while studying law. Admitted to bar in 1824. Clerk of Bath County in 1830. Commonwealth attorney for Bath County in 1830. Elected as a Whig to the Twenty-ninth Congress from March 4, 1845-March 3, 1847. Presidential elector on the Democratic ticket in 1848. Resumed the practice of law; moved to Franklin County, Ky. Died in Frankfort, Ky., August 21, 1871.

bibl.p: Conrad W. Feltner, Andrew Trumbo Letter (Middlesboro, Ky: C. W. Feltner, 1981).
